702941f-a.title: Brooklyn: 99th Street - Fort Hamilton Parkway
702941f-a.text:
(1)
419-433 99th Street, north side, between Fort Hamilton Parkway and
Fourth Ave. The buildings concerned are frame homes.
May 1O, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from a different angle, showing a close-up of the frame
house at No. 431-99th Street.
June 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

704426f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fort Hamilton Parkway - 99th Street
704426f-a.text:
(1)
Port Namilton Parkway, at the N.W. corner of 99th Street, showing
St. John's Episcopal Church and a double frame house (Nos. 9808-9810).
The church was organized in this community in the farmhouse of oue
Denyse, at the N.E. corner of Fort Hamilton Parkway and 101st Street,
on September 29, 1834. The Denyse heirs meservee a 1ot (1O0' x 125')
the present site, on which a frame building was erected. It was con-
secrated on July 16, 1835. On Dec. 24, 1890 this building was partly
burned, resulting in its demolition and the erecting of the present
one in 1897, which was consecrated on danuary 5, 1898.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MA. BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing the chapel belonging to the church which is part-
1y seen at the extreme left in No. 1.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
